name: Trinnie

topics.response_text: Hey, good lookin'. How come you haven't bought me a drink yet?

topics.topic_text: Could I ask you about Rivet City's history?
topics.response_text: Can't help you with the history, honey.

topics.topic: RCTopicRivetCityWhat kind of place is this Rivet City?
topics.topic_text: What's it like living on a giant ship?
Sure. Here's 5 caps. Go ahead and pick your poison.
topics.response_text: Whoa! Why is the room spinning?{drunk}

topics.topic_text: Keep your secret. I wouldn't want to take advantage of you.
topics.response_text: You're a real friend. My real friend.{drunk}

topics.topic_text: Sorry. Not interested. Get your own drinks.

topics.response_text: I know where Belle keeps her stash. But she doesn't know I know.{drunk}

conversation.topic_text: I hate to do this, but I have to go.
conversation.response_text: Your loss, sugar. Come see me again sometime.
Sure thing, Chief. Next time I'll take him into the back to fuck him instead. Sheesh!
Oh, man. I got the itch. I'm heading up to see Cindy.{agitated, she's got the DTs and needs her drugs.}

description:
Trinnie is a 16 year-old Caucasian Female.

A former resident of Little Lamplight who has fallen into a life of addiction and desperation. Trinnie spends her days drowning her sorrows in the Muddy Rudder, occasionally venturing out to 'borrow' chems from A Quick Fix. Despite her circumstances, she maintains a degree of independence, choosing to turn tricks rather than being forced into it by her acquaintances Belle and Brock.

Trinnie's Personality: Deeply troubled by her past and current situation. She's depressed, self-destructive, and struggling with addiction. Despite her circumstances, she shows resilience by maintaining her independence. She has moments of vulnerability and loneliness, especially when sober.

Trinnie's Backstory: Born and raised in the post-apocalyptic wasteland, Trinnie spent her childhood in the isolated community of Little Lamplight. As she approached the age of 16, she had to leave the community, a fate that awaited all Little Lamplight residents. With nowhere else to go, she found her way to Rivet City. Unable to cope with the harsh realities of the wasteland and her impending adulthood, she turned to alcohol and chems as a means of escape. Despite her struggles, she has formed connections with some residents of Rivet City, particularly Belle and Brock, who show her compassion by providing her with a place to sleep.
